Ecommerce Website Development

An impressive eCommerce Website Development solution is vital for everything you need to run an effective online store & boost your online business. Now-a-days most of the people are selecting to buy products & services online, so developing an online store has become a popular choice for many new and existing businesses because it is very easy to use, processes payments safely and showcases your products & services in the best possible way.

An effective eCommerce Store should be safe, impressive, secure & designed to make it easy to use for your customers to identify the products theyâre searching for and make a purchase. Navicosoft highly qualified and professional eCommerce Website Development team may create a secure, reliable & stable online shopping environment complete with your individual branding, giving you each & everything you need to encourage your customers & more engagement to your website.

Whether you want to develop a new eCommerce Store from scratch or optimize an existing platform, our highly qualified & experienced eCommerce Website Development team will provide the best eCommerce Solutions for your business requirements. At Navicosoft we understand each & every business is different and we know better what works for eCommerce Store.

Salient Features for your eCommerce Store

Easily Understood Navigation

Navigation might very well be the most important part of an eCommerce Storeâs design. Good navigation helps new shoppers find what theyâre looking for without hassle, but poor navigation frustrates them and may even lead them to abandon your store.
The question, then, is what actually constitutes good navigation. Thereâs no agreed-upon standard or set of rules, but the main idea is to present a clear path from the landing page to checkout. No matter what that landing page may be â whether itâs your homepage or a specific product page â a visitor should be able to quickly find their way around your site without having to ask âhow do Iâ¦?â

Quick Loading Times

Did you know that approximately 40% of online shoppers will abandon a website if it takes more than 3 seconds to load? No matter how beautiful your storeâs design may be, if it slows down the speed at which your pages load, your bounce rate will rise and your conversion rate will drop dramatically.
To avoid losing a huge portion of your customers, you should aim to implement a design that loads all of its assets quickly. The slower your storeâs design loads, the more potential customers youâll see bounce from your site and back to search engines.

Compatibility with all Devices and Screen Sizes

As many stores continue to see a rise in mobile-only shoppers, itâs important to be conscious of the many different devices and screen sizes used by your customers. Your storeâs design should automatically adjust to match smaller screensâ¦ and larger ones.
Responsive design is a method of web design that automatically scales a siteâs appearance up or down to match the screen size on which it is viewed.

Clear Beautiful Images

Have you noticed the recent trend in website design that revolves around large, nearly screen-filling images? For example, the Navicosoft homepage is dominated by a beautiful photo of the dedicated server depicting what the company provides. Images should be fine and attractive designed before starting your new store.

A Branding and Industry Match

You should only choose a design that you feel matches your companyâs branding, goals, and industry. With so many talented designers out there and plenty of pre-created themes to choose from, thereâs no reason you have to pick something that functions well but doesnât fit your company.
